ReviewList.Text: Highly recommended supplemental book for my Calculus-based physics class. It provided an excellent quick review on some topics from a while back, and a great summary and introduction to topics I needed to know for the course but had never been taught. Its not a substitute for taking a calculus course, but it is a great review if calculus was a while back, or if you never covered certain topics. Either way, this book will come in handy throughout your physics courses.
Probobly the best summery of mathematical physics an undergraduate could buy. Biman Das creates excelant physics review books.

I'm only part of the way through this book, and I've found a handful of typos. Normally, I wouldn't mind, but these typos affect the accuracy of the book's statements, which is highly concerning to me.
Great book if you need to go back over the basics before going back to classes or if you want to use it in conjunction with a physics class.
This text was a required book for a graduate level math course.  I found it very useful.  The information regarding calculus was well stated and easily understood.
Great resource for someone who has not been in touch with math for a while.
